Name: Awakening The Heart
Information: Tagline: Cultivating a Warm, Open, Joyful, and Loving Heart
Information: Quote: "The key to a happier and more successful world is the growth of compassion. We do not need to become religious, nor do we need to believe in an ideology. All that is necessary is for each of us to develop our good human qualities."
Information: Program Description:
About this Drop-In

These ongoing Awakening The Heart drop-ins meet every Monday morning and are dedicated to cultivating warm, open, and caring hearts through teachings and meditation centered around the four immeasurables: loving-kindness, compassion, appreciative joy, and equanimity. These practices promote well-being for ourselves, others, and the world.

During each session, we will explore diverse techniques and practices for cultivating these virtues, including meditation and Loving-Kindness meditation. We will also discuss how these teachings and practices can be integrated into our daily lives.
Information: Special Notes: No registration is necessary for this group, and is open to all community members. Whether you are new to these practices or have been practicing for many years, you are welcome to join us as we learn and practice together. We hope you will join us and discover the benefits of cultivating greater warmth, openness and care in your life and our shared world.
Registration: SIGNED-OUT Instructions: To participate in this and other RIM community programs, please Create a (free) Member Account. If you already have an account, simply Sign-In and go to your dashboard.
Registration: SIGNED-IN Instructions: As a RIM community member, you have access to this offering. A zoom link is accessible in your dashboard.
Dashboard: Early Arrival Message: You are welcome to join within 10 minutes of the start time for community sharing and fellowship.

Name: Bookmarks & Breath
Information: Quote: “We are all apprentices in a craft where no one ever becomes a master.”
Information: Program Description:
Bookmarks & Breath is a new quarterly book club at Rooted in Mindfulness.

We invite people of all experience levels to explore these books together. The goal is connection, curiosity, and shared learning, not having the right answers. Our intention is to create a space that feels welcoming, easy, fun, and human - a place for to get to know each other off our mats. There is no pressure to sound wise or polished, curiosity is more than enough.

The group will meet in person for about an hour at Rooted in Mindfulness, with no virtual option. Time together will include casual conversation and introductions, followed by a circle-style discussion using question cards inspired by the book. Each person will have a few minutes to share, supported by a timer so all voices are heard, and the gathering will close with open discussion. We welcome you to read, reflect, and come join our in our sharing.

Read deeply. Breathe fully. Share openly.

This community offering is hosted by Gina Dundun, a member of the RIM community and a fellow participant.
Information: Special Notes:
The first book selection is "The Places That Scare You: A Guide to Fearlessness in Difficult Times" by Pema Chödrön, a compassionate and practical exploration of how we meet fear, discomfort, and uncertainty.

Participants are encouraged to read the book in advance to support thoughtful discussion, though you are still welcome if you have not finished every page. ;-)

FIRST MEETING: Monday, Mar 30, 6:00pm
Details: Date Text: Quarterly on Monday Evenings | Mar 30 - First Meeting

Name: Boundless Heart
Information: Tagline: The study and practice of the Brahma Viharas: Kindness, Compassion, Joy, and Equanimity.
Information: Quote: "The Brahma Viharas—loving-kindness, compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity—are not qualities we need to create; they are qualities we uncover, cultivate, and live from in our lives."
Information: Program Description:
"At the heart of the teachings of the brahma viharas there is an invitation to radically transform the shape of our hearts through understanding. In their deepest sense, the brahma viharas are pathways of insight that bring confusion, greed, and hatred to an end, liberating the heart and establishing the mind in unshakeable and immeasurable kindness, compassion, joy and equanimity. They teach us to live in this world fearlessly, how to be a true friend to ourselves and others, and to cultivate an inner abiding that is a true refuge. They ennoble our lives and contribute to the healing of our world." - Christina Feldman

Using Christina Feldman's book "Boundless Heart," we will study and practice the Buddhist Brahma Viharas.

Holding the deepest question of who we want to be in the world, we will practice the steadiness of equanimity, the aliveness of joy, the tenderness of kindness, and the 'being' of compassion.

‍
Information: Special Notes:
Registration Closes Soon!

This course is held in person at RIM.

Reading the book "Boundless Heart" is encouraged but not required.

Name: Community Peace Meditation
Information: Quote: "It is my conviction that there is no way to peace—peace is the way."
Information: Program Description:
About this Drop-In

Amid challenging times, many seek peace, resilience, and a desire to be part of a healthy response. Our weekly Peace Meditation provides a collective space where we can protect and nurture the tranquility that resides within our hearts. This practice supports our engagement with life, empowering us to act with wisdom and compassion. We find strength and direction by acknowledging the shared humanity that binds us.

Every Friday, we come together online, creating a space to bring light to ourselves, others, and the world during these challenging times. Our sessions begin with a unifying sequence, grounding us in the present and preparing us to cultivate inner peace. Most of our gathering is held in noble silence, allowing for profound introspection, with only the initial guidance provided by the facilitator. We rest in the healing resource of our breath, exploring the boundless potential of heart-centered connection. We imagine this peace extending beyond our immediate surroundings, connecting with others, and reaching out to the world.

In this virtual space, we co-create an atmosphere of calm, healing, care, and understanding. Our goal is to find peace within and radiate it outward, influencing the larger world around us.
Information: Special Notes: This Meditation will be generously offered by community member Anna Lelko.
Details: Dana Text: Offered in the Spirit of Dana

Name: Day of Mindfulness
Information: Tagline: Retreats strengthen formal practice and mindful living.
Information: Quote: “With mindfulness, you can establish yourself in the present in order to touch the wonders of life that are available in that moment.”
Information: Program Description:
About this Retreat

Gift yourself a day of deep connection and self-care. Join us for a Day of Mindfulness to take care of body, heart, mind, and life. This retreat is designed to help you be present, connect deeply with life, and engage with the world more meaningfully.

Deepening Practice and Understanding

Our retreats focus on establishing and deepening your meditation practice, promoting a mindful life, and guiding you toward greater health, well-being, freedom, and awakening. They offer tools to skillfully navigate life's challenges such as stress, depression, and anxiety, fostering a journey from ill-being to well-being.

Cultivating Peace and Presence

Experience a special awareness that reconnects you with your innate wisdom and compassion, guiding you towards a fulfilling life. Guided meditations, teachings, nature immersion, community togetherness, and noble silence enhance your ability to live joyfully and meaningfully.

Rediscover What Matters Most

Life's stresses can obscure our core values and healthiest choices. This retreat offers a pause to rediscover what inspires authentic and purposeful living, bringing insight into true well-being, health, and happiness, and integrating these insights into daily life.

Living Authentically

Learn strategies that foster mindful awareness and align with your highest good. This retreat nurtures well-being on all levels—physical, emotional, and spiritual—empowering you to embody healthy ways of being.

A Transformative Experience

Beyond a break from routine, this Day of Mindfulness is an act of self-care that offers tools and insights for a more satisfying life. It supports you in navigating life's challenges gracefully and making enriching choices.

A Commitment to Mindful Living

See this Day of Mindfulness as a step towards a happier, healthier, and more mindful existence. It deepens your present-moment connection, authenticity, and appreciation of life's beauty, offering not just relaxation but meaningful change.
Information: Special Notes: This retreat is held at Cedar Valley - UCCI, 5349 Co Rd D, West Bend, WI 53090

Name: Day of Mindfulness
Information: Quote: “With mindfulness, you can establish yourself in the present in order to touch the wonders of life that are available in that moment.”
Information: Program Description:
You are Invited to a Gentle Day of Presence and Care

Taking time to pause and care for ourselves helps us reconnect with what’s already whole within us. This Day of Mindfulness offers a peaceful space to rest, reflect, and return to the strength and clarity we carry inside.

Whether you’re new to mindfulness or an experienced practitioner, this retreat offers a simple, supportive space to reconnect—with yourself, others, and life.

What to Expect

This day-long retreat blends the quiet power of silence with the nourishment of community. We’ll explore:

  • Guided meditations to cultivate calm and clarity
  • Mindful movement to connect body and breath
  • Teachings and reflections grounded in compassion and presence
  • Time in nature to remember your place in the larger web of life
  • Noble silence to support inward turning and deep listening
  • Community togetherness—being alone, together, in peace

There’s no pressure to perform or “get it right”—just an open invitation to show up as you are.

Why Attend?

This retreat is an opportunity to:

  • Step out of routine and into presence
  • Recharge emotionally, physically, and spiritually
  • Gain insight into patterns of stress and reactivity
  • Nurture compassion for yourself and others
  • Remember what matters most in your life
  • Experience meaningful rest, reflection, and renewal

A Day for You

Many people find that even one day of mindfulness can create a powerful shift in how they relate to life. This isn’t about escaping the world—it’s about learning to be more present and alive within it.

We invite you to take this time for yourself—not as a luxury, but as a way to care deeply for your well-being and return to your life with more peace, wisdom, and intention.
Information: Special Notes: This retreat is held at Cedar Valley - UCCI, 5349 Co Rd D, West Bend, WI 53090

Name: Day of Mindfulness
Information: Quote: “With mindfulness, you can establish yourself in the present in order to touch the wonders of life that are available in that moment.”
Information: Program Description:
About this Day Retreat

Sometimes it's good to have longer periods to rest into our practice. We need dedicated time—time to truly stop, to let the body unwind, to remember what it feels like to just be without the pressures of our to-dos and agendas. Time to move more slowly and to be fully present with ourselves. A Day of Mindfulness offers that kind of time: space to compassionately deepen our understanding of ourselves and care for ourselves with kindness.

This day is an opportunity for extended practice, rest, integration, and healing. It can support those who want to go deeper in their formal practice, and for those just beginning, it offers a supportive, guided introduction to meditation and mindful living.

Noble Silence

We spend most of the day in what's called "noble silence." It's not silence as a rule or restriction—it's silence undertaken with intention, as an act of care for ourselves and others. Without small talk, without phones, without needing to be "on," something in us can settle. The mind grows quieter. The body relaxes. We can turn inward and listen more deeply to our own experience—and to this life we're living.

That listening is a gift: to ourselves, to those we love, and to the world we're part of.

What the Day Includes

You'll be gently guided throughout the day, with plenty of room for quiet, restful contemplation.

  • Guided and silent sitting meditation
  • Walking meditation outdoors and/or indoors
  • A meal eaten together in silence—the comfort of community without the pressure to engage
  • Brief teachings and reflection
  • Time for rest and solitude in nature or in supportive indoor spaces
  • Optional dialogue near the end of the day to support integration

Who This Day Is For

People come carrying all sorts of things—the momentum of their lives and the full spectrum of what it means to be human:

  • Stress, grief, exhaustion, overwhelm
  • The weight of personal and societal pressures
  • A longing for healing, stillness, or rest
  • A desire to appreciate what is already well and healthy

You don't need to arrive in any particular state. You're coming to be with your life more fully. Whatever brings you, you are welcome.

What This Day Can Offer

A Day of Mindfulness Retreat is gentle, yet profoundly supportive—and often deeply transformative. It can be a kind of medicine: not a way to "fix" ourselves, but a way to access our innate capacity to live with greater resilience, understanding, and compassion—for ourselves and others.

In that space, a healthier relationship with our minds and lives becomes even more possible. We grow our capacity to see the patterns that create unnecessary stress and suffering—and to loosen their grip. We learn to live in a more healing and integrated way.

By the end of the day, most people feel different. Not fixed—just more settled. More in their bodies. More connected. More able to remember and stay connected to what is important, well, and good. This is profoundly supportive of our intentions to live well and be happy.

Open to Everyone

This retreat welcomes newcomers and experienced practitioners alike. There's no pressure to do anything perfectly—you're coming to rest, and to be. All you need to do is show up to the fullness of yourself and your life.

The day includes a meal and refreshments.
Information: Special Notes:
Location: Cedar Valley

The retreat is held at Cedar Valley - UCCI, 5349 Co Rd D, West Bend, WI 53090, a quiet setting of woods, prairies, a pond, trails, and more. It's a good place to let the pace of the land, facilities, and intentional people support one another.

Name: Day of Mindfulness April 2024
Information: Tagline: Retreats strengthen formal practice and mindful living.
Information: Quote: “With mindfulness, you can establish yourself in the present in order to touch the wonders of life that are available in that moment.”
Information: Program Description:
About this Retreat

Step away from the hustle and bustle of daily life and immerse yourself in a supportive, day-long mindfulness retreat. This meaningful day will allow you to cultivate presence, reduce stress, and deepen your connection with yourself and your life.

Taking Care of Yourself

During this retreat, you will be guided through various mindfulness practices designed to learn and/or deepen your meditation skills, foster greater mindfulness, open your heart, and realize your innate capacity for happiness and well-being. You will be supported with traditional and modern teachings, guided meditations, time in nature, community support, and periods of noble silence for inner contemplation and practice. Discover and Learn

‍Focus on establishing and deepening your meditation practice, promoting a mindful life, and guiding you toward greater health, well-being, freedom, and awakening. Learn tools to skillfully navigate life's challenges, such as stress, depression, and anxiety, fostering a journey from ill-being to well-being.

Rediscover and Uncover Your Innate Goodness and Well-being

Discover how meditation and mindful awareness can reconnect you with your innate wisdom and compassion, guiding you toward a fulfilling life. This retreat offers a pause to rediscover what inspires authentic and purposeful living, bringing insight into true well-being, health, and happiness and integrating these insights into daily life.

Embrace Self-Care and Transformation

See this Day of Mindfulness as an act of self-care that provides tools and insights for a more satisfying life. It supports you in navigating life's challenges with grace and making enriching choices. This retreat is a step towards a happier, healthier, and more mindful existence, deepening your present-moment connection, authenticity, and appreciation of life's beauty, offering relaxation and meaningful change.

Please Join Us

Join us for this transformative experience and take the first step toward a more mindful and fulfilling life. Register to reserve your spot. Space is limited, so early registration is encouraged.
Information: Special Notes:
Special Note About this Retreat

Lunch and Snacks: A vegetarian lunch, coffee, water, and tea are provided.

Location: This retreat is held at Cedar Valley, nestled on 100 beautiful acres adorned with winding trails, a reflection pond, an outdoor labyrinth, and a chapel—all designed to enhance and support your experience during this retreat.

Name: Eating With Mindful Intention
Information: Quote: "Eating with Mindfulness and gratitude, our food becomes sacred nourishment.”
Information: Program Description:
When we develop a practice of meditation and mindful living, we become more available to choose what's nourishing for our bodies, hearts, and minds.

Join us for a practice of nourishing the Body, Heart, and Mind - a meditation and mindful eating experience.

Our bodies, hearts, and minds are nourished by the actual food we consume, as well as our sensory experience, intentions, and awareness itself. Mindful Eating is a practice of being fully present and aware while preparing and consuming food, paying attention to the food and its source, our relationship to the food, and its impact on our well-being. It encompasses being conscious of our intentions, considering sensory experiences, and cultivating an awakened consciousness while consuming food.

This workshop is designed to cultivate presence, connection, and nourishment. Participants will have the opportunity to explore and practice the profound benefits of meditation and the art of mindful eating. There will be periods of guided meditation, noble silence, and shared experience.
Information: Special Notes: Registration for this workshop has closed.

Name: Essential Dharma Study
Information: Tagline: An Ongoing Exploration into The Essence of Traditional Buddhist Teachings
Information: Quote: "The dharma is every breath we take, every thought we think, every word we speak, if we do it with awareness and an open, caring heart."
Information: Program Description:
About this Dharma Study Group

Join us on a journey of discovery and personal growth with our Essential Dharma Study Group at RIM, a supportive community dedicated to exploring the core teachings shared by most major Buddhist schools. Together, we aim to help each other seamlessly integrate these teachings into our meditation practices and daily lives, fostering a deeper connection to the Essential Dharma.

Embracing the Spirit of Kalyana Mitta

Kalyana Mitta, a Pali term meaning "spiritual friend," embodies the essence of our group. By engaging with fellow travelers on the Dharma path, we encourage ongoing learning, meditation practice, and mindful living. Our Essential Dharma Study Group is a place of connection and mutual support, open to all RIM community members, from newcomers to seasoned practitioners.

Guidance, Support, and Shared Wisdom

Facilitated by RIM's Guiding Teacher, Jesse Foy, our group emphasizes peer-to-peer dialogue and shared practice. In Jesse's absence, we hold space for one another, drawing on the collective wisdom and diverse experiences of our fellow practitioners.

Meeting Schedule and Format

Our Essential Dharma Study Group meets each Thursday between Essential Dharma Courses, from 9:30 am to 10:30 am. Each session delves into a specific Dharma topic chosen by us or the guiding teacher, with an equal opportunity for all members to share their insights and experiences. The session concludes with a short Loving-Kindness practice.

Learning and Practice Beyond Meetings

We encourage each other to actively engage with the Dharma topics explored in group sessions and complementary Essential Dharma Study Courses. By examining patterns in our daily lives, we create a starting point for discussion at the next meeting, with each participant benefiting from the discoveries of all members.

An Online Community Space for Continued Connection

As registered participants, we will have access to a private online space, where we can further connect, learn, and receive practice support. Participation in the online community is encouraged but optional, offering a safe and supportive environment for us to share resources, discuss topics, and deepen our understanding of the Essential Dharma.
Information: Special Notes:
Registration

Please register once to join and participate in this ongoing study group.

Name: Foundations of Mindful Living
Information: Quote: “The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.”
Information: Program Description:
About this Supportive Workshop

Are you looking for a way to bring more ease, clarity, and balance into your life? The Foundations of Mindful Living workshop offers a gentle yet profound introduction to meditation and mindful living—grounded in traditional wisdom yet deeply relevant to our modern lives.  

This experiential and accessible workshop is designed for anyone serious about developing a skillful and sustainable mindfulness practice—whether you are just beginning or looking to strengthen your foundation. Through guided meditation, reflection, and discussion, you will learn how to cultivate awareness, compassion, and resilience, allowing you to navigate life with greater presence and freedom.  

What You’ll Gain:  

  • A clear and supportive introduction to meditation and mindful living
  • Practical tools to reduce stress and enhance well-being
  • A deeper understanding of how mindfulness fosters clarity, emotional balance, and inner peace
  • A safe and encouraging space to explore mindfulness at your own pace

Who is this for?  

This workshop is ideal for anyone who wants to integrate mindfulness into daily life in a way that is gentle, safe, and transformative. No prior experience is necessary—just a willingness to begin.
Information: Special Notes:
Note about Lunch and Snacks:

Please bring a bag lunch and your own cup. Snacks, tea, and other goodies will be offered as part of the registration costs. Please let us know if you have any food sensitivities so we can best support you.

Name: Foundations of Mindful Living
Information: Quote: "Every morning, when we wake up, we have twenty-four brand-new hours to live. What a precious gift! We have the capacity to live in a way that these twenty-four hours will bring peace, joy, and happiness to ourselves and others."
Information: Program Description:
About this Course

We live in a time that asks a great deal of us. Many of us are carrying more than we realize—stress that has settled into our bodies, worry that colors our days, a sense of disconnection from ourselves and the people we love. We do our best to meet the demands of life, but something essential can get lost along the way. The practices in this course offer a way back to our greater intentions and how to live in harmony with them.

Mindfulness is the simple and profound act of being present—to ourselves, to each other, to life as it actually is. It is not an escape from difficulty, but a way of meeting it with greater clarity, steadiness, and care.

When we learn to be present, we begin to see more clearly. We respond rather than react. We discover resources within ourselves we didn't know we had. And we become more available—to our own lives and to the people who need us.

Foundations of Mindful Living is a 4-week course offering a clear and practical path into meditation and mindful living. Whether you are new to practice or returning to strengthen your foundation, this course will give you what you need to begin—and to continue.

The Path We'll Walk Together

This course is grounded in the Mindfulness-Based C.A.R.E. Framework—a path of practice that moves from settling the mind and body, to seeing ourselves clearly, to living with intention and purpose.

  • ‍Calm & Connect: We begin where all practice begins—by arriving. Learning to settle the nervous system, to find ground in the present moment, to come home to ourselves. This is the foundation. From a place of steadiness, everything else becomes possible.‍
  • Awareness & Attitude: With some stillness established, we turn toward our experience with open eyes and hearts. We learn to observe our thoughts, emotions, and habits—not to judge them, but to understand. And we cultivate the attitude that makes this seeing healing rather than harsh: curiosity, patience, kindness toward ourselves.‍
  • Remember & Reflect: Practice is not only what happens on the cushion. It is learning to remember presence in the midst of daily life—while walking, working, listening, and the full spectrum of life. And it is the art of reflection: looking at our lives honestly, discovering what matters, and understanding ourselves more deeply.‍
  • Embody & Engage: Finally, we bring what we have cultivated into the world. We learn to embody presence in our bodies and our actions. We engage with difficulty without being swept away. And we offer the fruit of our practice to those we love and to the wider world that needs our clarity and care.

What You Will Cultivate

  • A sustainable meditation practice you can carry forward for a lifetime.
  • The capacity to meet stress, difficulty, and strong emotions with greater skill.
  • A quality of presence that transforms ordinary moments—and your relationships.
  • The understanding that your own well-being and the well-being of others are not separate.

Who This Is For

This course is for anyone who senses that a more present, grounded, and meaningful life is possible—and who is ready to begin.

You may be experiencing stress, anxiety, or exhaustion and seeking real tools to help. You may be longing for greater clarity or connection. You may be curious about meditation but unsure where to start. Or you may have practiced for years and want to return to the foundations with fresh eyes.

No experience is necessary. Come as you are.

What's Included

  • ‍Four Weekly Sessions 90 minutes each, live on Zoom—a supportive space to learn, practice, and ask questions.‍
  • Home Practice Support Guided meditations, mindful living practices, and reflection prompts to weave what you're learning into daily life.‍
  • A Foundation for Continued Practice This course is complete in itself. It also serves as the gateway to deeper study, retreats, and ongoing community at Rooted in Mindfulness.
Information: Special Notes:
Go Deeper

While not required, we encourage participants to attend a Day of Mindfulness Retreat following this course (Saturday, March 21). A day of extended practice is a beautiful way to integrate and deepen what you've learned—offering spaciousness, stillness, and the support of practicing together in community. Registration will open soon.

Information: Quote: "With the support of friends in the practice, peace has a chance."
Information: Program Description:
Cultivating stability and awareness through daily meditation practice is a kind and generous act. When we practice together, we support each other and develop a greater sense of well-being.

Good Evening meditations are held Sunday through Thursday evenings. Each session will provide initial guidance by an experienced community member, sharing traditional instructions to help settle your body and mind, open your heart, and establish your meditation practice. The rest of the 30 min meditation is unguided. Listen to a Sample Meditation.

These sessions open 10 minutes early to establish our space together and are held in Noble Silence.

Name: Introduction to Mindful Living
Information: Quote: “Cultivating well-being through mindfulness is not a destination, but a journey. It's about finding peace and joy in the ordinary moments, discovering the extraordinary in the ordinary.”
Information: Program Description:
Class Overview:‍

Are you curious about how meditation and mindfulness can enrich your daily life, support healing, and nurture genuine well-being? At Rooted in Mindfulness, we invite you to join our supportive 1.5-hour introductory class, caringly crafted to gently guide you into the transformative potential of these practices.

What You’ll Experience:

  • Essenitals of Meditation and Mindfulness: Discover the core principles of meditation and how cultivating mindfulness can bring clarity, calm, connection, and meaning to your everyday life.
  • Skillful Meditation Practice: Engage in guided meditations designed to teach the essentials of a sustainable meditation practice—one that helps you deepen your connection to the present moment, gain insight into your heart and mind, and foster lasting well-being.
  • Practical Integration for Mindful Living: Learn straightforward, effective techniques to incorporate mindfulness into your daily life, reducing stress and enhancing your overall quality of life.
  • Building a Lifelong Foundation: Establish a strong basis for those who wish to continue exploring meditation and mindful living as a life practice.
  • Optional Shared Reflection: Participate in an open, supportive dialogue to ask questions, share experiences, and connect with a caring community. Sharing is entirely optional.

This class is open to all—whether you’re stepping onto the path for the first time or revisiting these timeless practices. Our universal approach ensures the teachings resonate with people from all backgrounds and experiences.

We look forward to walking this path together, uncovering the profound potential of mindful living to transform our lives with presence, understanding, and compassion.

Name: Love as a Way of Being
Information: Tagline: Understanding, Kindness, and Compassion: A Medicine for Our Times.
Information: Quote: “Love's in need of love today / Don't delay / Send yours in right away.”
Information: Program Description:
About this Workshop:

Inspired by the heartfelt message of Stevie Wonder's powerful song "Love's in Need of Love Today," join us for a transformative day-long workshop/retreat dedicated to cultivating a heart and mind that radiates kindness and compassion. In these challenging times, the virtues of understanding and love are more than mere sentiments—they are potent medicines that nurture wellness and promote healing both within ourselves and in the wider world. This workshop is designed for those who recognize the profound power of love as a fundamental force for personal and global transformation.

Cultivating an Embodiment of Love

Throughout the day, we will explore how the conditions of our inner and outer worlds sometimes contribute to our disconnection from our innate kindness and compassion. Whether it’s due to numbness, indifference, or the stresses of daily life, we can find ourselves drifting away from our authentic nature. This workshop serves as an opportunity to reconnect with and strengthen that nature, reaffirming that understanding, kindness, and compassion are not only parts of our true self but also manifestations of our deepest health and vitality.

What to Expect

  • ‍Guided Loving-Kindness Practices: Engage in heart-opening meditations designed to awaken and expand your natural capacity for kindness and compassion towards yourself and others.‍
  • Interactive Teachings: Participate in guided teachings that delve into the psychology of compassion and kindness, exploring how these states of mind can be actively cultivated and maintained even in the face of life’s challenges.‍
  • Practical Applications: Learn practical ways to integrate these compassionate practices into everyday life, ensuring that the seeds planted during our time together continue to grow and flourish.
  • ‍Supportive Community: Enjoy the collective energy of a community of like-minded individuals, all committed to cultivating a healthier, more compassionate world.‍
  • Periods of Reflection and Practice: Experience periods of noble silence for inner contemplation, allowing you to deeply connect with and internalize the teachings of the day in this beautiful lakehouse setting.

Further Awaken Your Innate Goodness

This workshop is more than just a retreat from daily life; it’s a profound engagement with life’s highest potential. By nurturing the qualities of kindness and compassion, we not only heal ourselves but also extend that healing outward, making a tangible difference in a world that yearns for genuine connection and care.

Please Join Us

This day is an invitation to step into the strength of heart and mind that can truly embody the beautiful, living medicine of love and understanding. It’s an act of self-care that not only enriches your own life but also empowers you to bring about meaningful change in the lives of others. Space is limited, and early registration is encouraged to secure your place in this life-affirming journey.
Information: Special Notes:
Notes About this Workshop/Retreat:

This workshop/retreat will take place at a special location in Port Washington. A kind and generous community member is offering her famliy's Lakehouse for this special offering. Upon registration, you will receive the detailed directions to this beautiful and peaceful house on the shore of Lake Michigan.

What to bring:

  • Suitable attire for walking outdoors ~ There will  be periods of indoor and outdoor practice.
  • A journal or sketchbook for reflection, if desired.
  • Light Snacks and beverages will be offered, but we ask that you bring a packed lunch.

Capacity: 24 attendees (This offering will likely fill up quickly. Early registration is recommended.)

Name: Meditation and Dharma Talk
Information: Tagline: Deepening Meditation and Mindful Living Practice
Information: Quote: “Mindfulness, also called wise attention, helps us see what we’re adding to our experiences, not only during meditation sessions but also elsewhere.”
Information: Program Description:
These Saturday drop-ins provide ongoing support for developing a skillful meditation practice and integrating the benefits of mindfulness into everyday life. Learn ways to transform unhealthy patterns of heart and mind while cultivating true well-being, wisdom, compassion, and freedom in ourselves and our shared world.

Each weekly session includes guided meditations and teachings based on traditional buddhist and modern mindfulness-based modalities. Everyone is welcome; please, come just as you are.

Name: Mindful Communication
Information: Quote: “Speech is a powerful way to connect with others. By practicing right speech, we learn to express ourselves in ways that set positive boundaries yet are respectful and considerate.”
Information: Program Description:
Workshop Overview:‍

Have you ever walked away from a conversation filled with confusion or regret about what was said or not said? Wise, compassionate, and skillful action has the potential to transform difficult interactions. Mindful communication is a powerful avenue to cultivate this intention.

During this 2.5-hour workshop, we will explore what mindful communication truly means and common challenges like listening with empathy, expressing ourselves honestly yet kindly, and navigating difficult conversations with mindfulness.

You'll discover ways to refine your communication skills through guided meditations, interactive lessons, hands-on practice, and open discussions, making every conversation more meaningful and connected.

Who Should Attend:

This workshop is an invitation to everyone who wishes to deepen their understanding and practice of communication, inspired by the principles of Mindfulness, wisdom, and compassion.

Please Join Us at RIM‍

Name: Mindful Day in Nature
Information: Tagline: A Retreat/Workshop for Deep Connection and Self-Discovery
Information: Quote: "If you are a poet, you will see clearly that there is a cloud floating in this sheet of paper. Without a cloud, there will be no rain. Without the rain, the trees cannot grow, and without the trees, we cannot make paper."
Information: Program Description:
Join us...

... for a transformative day of practice and exploration at a beautiful lakeside setting, where nature becomes our guide and teacher.

In this day-long retreat, we'll step away from our everyday routines to explore the profound wisdom that emerges when we truly connect with the natural world—and discover how deeply interconnected we are with everything around us.

Through a blend of guided contemplations, nature-based practices, and gentle sharing circles, we'll explore fundamental questions: What does it mean to be truly present? How are we connected to the larger web of life? Who are we beyond the roles and identities we carry?

What to Expect

The day unfolds through a gentle rhythm of gathering together and venturing out into nature, creating space for both shared discovery and personal insight. We'll:

  • Practice seeing with fresh eyes through contemplative exercises with trees and natural elements
  • Explore our many roles and identities, discovering the spaciousness that exists beyond them
  • Experience guided meditations that open us to the vastness of awareness
  • Gather in optional sharing circles that honor indigenous wisdom traditions (sharing is always invited, never required)
  • Enjoy a mindful lunch together in silence, contemplating the interconnected journey of our food

Rather than being "taught," you'll be invited to discover insights through your own direct experience, guided by thoughtful questions and supportive practices. We'll explore how the boundaries between self and nature, between "me" and "not me," are more fluid than they appear—and how this understanding can bring greater freedom and authenticity to daily life.

Who This Is For

This retreat welcomes anyone curious about deepening their relationship with nature and themselves. Whether you're new to mindfulness or have an established practice, you'll find accessible ways to explore these profound themes. No special knowledge or experience is required—just an open mind and willingness to explore.

Join Us

Come discover how losing yourself in nature might be the key to finding your most authentic self. In recognizing our place in the greater whole, we find both humility and empowerment—understanding that we are both uniquely ourselves and inseparably part of the vast, interconnected dance of life.

Limited spaces available. Register soon to reserve your spot for this intimate gathering in nature's classroom.
Information: Special Notes:
What to Bring

  • A small meaningful object (something that fits in your hand) that holds significance for you—this will serve as both a talking piece for our circles and an object for contemplation practices
  • A journal or notebook
  • A water bottle for water and tea throughout the day
  • Weather-appropriate clothing for outdoor practice
  • An open, curious heart

What We'll Provide

  • The facilitators will make a nourishing lunch for you
  • Tea and refreshments
  • All practice materials

Please let us know about any food allergies or dietary restrictions when you register.
Registration: SIGNED-OUT Instructions: This Retreat is Full. Please email us to be waitlisted.
Registration: SIGNED-IN Instructions: This Retreat is Full. Please email us to be waitlisted.

Name: Mindful Eating With CARE
Information: Tagline: Nourishing our Bodies, Hearts, and Minds
Information: Quote: "Eating with Mindfulness and gratitude, our food becomes sacred nourishment.”
Information: Program Description:
About this Workshop

When we practice meditation and mindful living, we can choose what nourishes our bodies, hearts, and minds. Join us for a nourishing practice through meditation and mindful eating.

We are nourished by the actual food we consume, as well as our sensory experience, intentions, and awareness itself. Mindful Eating is a practice of being fully present and aware while preparing and consuming food, paying attention to the food and its source, our relationship to the food, and its impact on our well-being. It encompasses being conscious of our intentions, considering sensory experiences, and cultivating an awakened consciousness while consuming food.

This workshop is designed to cultivate presence, connection, and nourishment. Participants will have the opportunity to explore and practice the profound benefits of meditation and the art of mindful eating. There will be periods of guided meditation, noble silence, and shared experience.
Information: Special Notes: Food samples will exclude animal and wheat products. Please get in touch with us before registering if you have any severe food allergies.

Name: Mindful Yoga
Information: Quote: "We can learn to trust the refuge of our own body."
Information: Program Description:
About this Course

Moving the body mindfully, with right effort and right intention, can be a beautiful support to deepening your meditation practice. Mindful Yoga can be a type of mindfulness of the body meditation practice—a gentle, supportive way to bring the body closer to its natural state of harmony and balance.

This practice provides the opportunity to care for the physical body and create the conditions that cultivate and strengthen mind-body awareness. Slow, gentle movement with deep awareness can enrich our inner experience, strengthen self-regulation, and help release different forms of stress that often create dis-ease in the body. Mindful Yoga gives rise to awareness, concentration, and insight.

During this 4-week offering, we will explore moving and caring for the body in relationship to the four elements of earth, air, fire, and water.  In each class, there will be an invitation to set our intention on cultivating a compassionate relationship with the true nature of the body.

We welcome both new and experienced practitioners to join us as we explore and deepen our meditation and Yoga practice together.
Details: Location Text: Special Location: United Unitarian Universalist Congregation 506 N. Washington Ave Waukesha

Name: Mindfulness and Sacred Clarity Workshop
Information: Tagline: Taking Care Through Meditation and Mindful Living
Information: Quote: "The mind is like water. When it's turbulent, it's difficult to see. Remove the turbulence and you will see clarity."
Information: Program Description:
About This Workshop

We're living in challenging times that affect us deeply. Yet even amidst struggle, we seek to live fully—caring for ourselves, others, and our world. This practice invites us to turn toward the source of both our difficulties and our wellbeing: our hearts and minds.

Sacred Clarity means seeing through confusion and reactivity—not by withdrawing from life, but by meeting it with understanding, care, and presence. We use 'sacred' in its most universal sense—honoring the profound in everyday life, the precious in each moment. It's a deeply human clarity that helps us live true to what matters most.

Who Should Attend

Whether you're just beginning or deepening a lifelong practice, this workshop is for you. It's for anyone curious about living with clarity—for their own benefit and for the wider world.

What We'll Explore

In this supportive workshop, you'll learn to:

  • Establish or deepen a meditation practice grounded in compassion and clarity
  • Integrate mindfulness into daily life for wiser, more wholehearted living
  • Navigate personal and collective challenges with steadiness and discernment
  • Recognize and nurture goodness and beauty, even in difficult times

We'll work with the Mindfulness-Based C.A.R.E. Framework—an accessible method for bringing these teachings into everyday life.

An Invitation

This isn't about escaping reality but turning toward it—together. Come as you are, whether beginning your journey or renewing your commitment.

For your wellbeing. For others. For the world we're all shaping.

All who feel drawn to awakening Sacred Clarity are welcome.
Information: Special Notes: This workshop meets you where you are—offering beginners a gentle foundation and experienced practitioners fresh depth. If you feel drawn to awakening Sacred Clarity, you belong here.

Name: Mindfulness in Nature: A Half-Day Retreat
Information: Tagline: Retreats strengthen formal practice and mindful living.
Information: Quote: “Nature is not a place to visit, it’s a place to come home to.”
Information: Program Description:
Step out of the habitual patterns of daily life—a life often obscured by reactivity, distraction, and disconnection—and immerse yourself in the rejuvenating atmosphere of nature at our half-day nature bathing retreat, inspired by the Japanese practice of shinrin-yoku.

Generously hosted at a tranquil lake house near Port Washington on the beautiful shores of Lake Michigan by a RIM Community member, this sanctuary invites you to unplug and tune in to the beauty of the season with all your senses, fostering a more authentic relationship with yourself and your life.

  • Nature Immersion: Engage all your senses as you become truly present, immersing yourself in the truth, beauty, and energy of the season. Experience the healing powers of nature, a medicine we embrace with our whole being — through our five senses and with open hearts and minds. Let nature remind you of what is true and important, illuminating your inner self as you connect with the greater whole.
  • Digital Detox: Distance yourself from daily distractions, nurture kindness, and care for yourself in a supportive environment that encourages awakening to your more authentic self.
  • Simple Guided Meditations & Self-Reflections: Through guided meditations and self-reflection, open yourself to the profound wisdom held within the natural laws of nature. Create a space to rediscover what's important, breaking free from habitual patterns and opening up to the richness and fullness of life.
  • Gratitude and Presence: Cultivate a spirit of gratitude and presence. Discover ways to realize greater well-being and happiness as you open up to your inner and outer nature, finding methods to integrate them into your daily life.

Capacity: 25 Attendees

Join us for a transformative journey into the season's embrace. Learn, through simply being present with open hearts and minds, to unearth your potential for real happiness and well-being. Rediscover your connection to the larger whole, nourished by the grounding experience of mindfulness in nature.

Name: Naikan: A Practice of Healing through Deep Looking
Information: Quote: “It is the familiar that usually eludes us in life. What is before our nose is what we see last.”
Information: Program Description:
A personal note from the Facilitor (Jesse Foy):

Of all the practices I practice and share, Naikan holds a special place in my heart. I practice it regularly alongside loving-kindness, compassion, appreciative joy, and equanimity—but Naikan has a unique power to bring life-changing understanding and healing to how we see ourselves and everyone we're in relationship with. It's illuminating in ways that are hard to describe until you experience it: suddenly you notice what's always been there, and that noticing changes everything.

I'm offering this workshop because I genuinely want you to have this practice in your life—not just to learn about it, but to walk away with a skill you can use immediately and return to again and again.

What is Naikan?

Naikan is a Japanese method of structured self-reflection—literally "inside looking"—that helps you see your life and relationships more completely. Instead of analyzing yourself or circling the same old stories, Naikan invites you to examine specific relationships through three deceptively simple questions:

  1. What have I received from this person?
  2. What have I given to this person?
  3. What troubles or difficulties have I caused this person?

How this 3-hour workshop works:

We'll explore the meaning and purpose of Naikan—why these questions matter and what they reveal. Then you'll practice the methods with deep intention, establishing the foundation so you can continue on your own. We won't move through all the years and people of your life (that's the work of longer retreats and an opportunity for you to do as a personal practice), but you'll experience the rhythm: quiet reflection followed by brief, supportive check-ins to help you and fellow participants understand and integrate the practice and holding space for what emerges without judgment.

What often shifts:

When you consistently ask these questions, something softens. You begin to see a fuller picture: the care you didn't register, the impact you didn't notice, the ways you've both been held and caused difficulty. This wider view often brings a quieter kind of gratitude, clearer responsibility, and more tenderness—toward yourself and others.

It's not about forcing positivity or getting rid of hard feelings. It's about seeing what else is true with greater understanding and care.

What you'll take home:

You'll leave with a practice you can use right away—as daily reflection, occasional life review, or a way to work with specific relationships when they feel stuck. Optional community support is available as you continue.
Information: Special Notes: No prior meditation experience needed. Just willingness to spend time with your memories and see what you haven't been seeing.

Name: Nature Meditation KM Group
Information: Quote: "To meditate in nature is to bring an attentiveness to the world around you and a curiosity about your inner and outer environment. To do so means to draw on the innate quality of mindfulness, which is the simple capacity to be aware, to know what is happening in your direct experience.”
Information: Program Description:
Would you like to join us for mindful walks in nature?

From the very beginning, the Buddha was intimately connected to the Earth. He left his home, lived in the forest, meditated in nature and awakened under a tree next to a river. When Mara questioned his enlightenment, the Buddha didn’t say anything. He simply touched the earth as witness to his realization.

The Nature Meditation Group plans to meet once a month in different local parks to hike and meditate together, using Mark Coleman’s A Field Guide to Nature Meditation as a guide.  These will be intentionally quiet walks with light guidance.
Information: Special Notes:
Communication and planning …

  • Interested members of the RIM Sangha should register for the group. 
  • Registered members will be contacted approximately three weeks in advance with details about the next planned hike and members will be asked to RSVP for individual monthly hikes.  

Other considerations …

  • Each of the monthly outings will take about 60 minutes, including a hike, meditation and time to discuss the experience.
  • Group members must have the physical ability to hike on uneven terrain for about 30-45 minutes.  
  • Though we will try to find a place to sit for meditation, participants may wish to bring something waterproof to sit on during the meditation. 
  • Participants are encouraged to wear sturdy shoes, dress for changing weather and bring a water bottle and snack. 
  • Participants are responsible for their own transportation to/from the park and potential park entrance fees.

Information: Quote: From the very beginning, the Buddha was intimately connected to the Earth. He left his home, lived in the forest, meditated in nature and awakened under a tree next to a river.When Mara questioned his enlightenment, the Buddha didn’t say anything. He simply touched the earth as witness to his awakening.
Information: Program Description:
Would you like to join us for mindful walks in nature?

Communication and Planning

  • All registered participants will receive one email confirmation outlining the dates, time, and location of all Nature Meditation KM Group gatherings for the 2026 season.
  • The gathering information will be also be posted in the RIM weekly newsletter the week prior to the event.
  • A reminder email will be sent to all registered participants the week prior to the event.
  • Registered members will receive email communication about last minute cancellations due to inclement weather. If you have invited non-members to join you, please keep them informed.

Other Considerations

  • Each of the monthly group gatherings will take about 75 minutes, including a walk, guided meditation(s) and time to discuss the experience.
  • Participants must have the physical ability to walk on uneven terrain for about 45 minutes. The pace will be slow and the trails relatively easy.
  • While we try to avoid areas where poison ivy is present, it is a good idea to wear closed toe shoes and socks.  Similarly, lightweight, long sleeve tops and pants protect you from flying insects.  
  • Participants are encouraged to bring bug spray, sunscreen and a water bottle.

Name: Our Hearts Were Made For This
Information: Tagline: Cultivating a Warm, Open, Joyful, and Loving Heart
Information: Quote: “Radiate boundless love towards the entire world – above, below, and across – unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.”
Information: Program Description:
About this Drop-In

We are kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity. These qualities are not just aspirations; they are the essence of who we are. Together, we can cultivate and deepen our connection to them.

Join us each Sunday as we explore the practice of LovingKindness.

Our time together begins with a brief dharma talk to set the tone and frame our meditation. The guided practice will last 20-30 minutes, followed by an optional discussion—a space to ask questions, share reflections, or simply listen.

Kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity are qualities that help us meet life with courage. They guide us to be a true friend to ourselves and others, reconnecting us to an inner refuge that is always here.
Information: Special Notes: No registration is necessary for this group, which is open to all community members. Whether you are new to these practices or have been practicing for many years, you are welcome to join us as we learn and practice together. We hope you will join us and discover the benefits of cultivating greater warmth, openness, and care in your life and our shared world.

Name: Private Teacher Meetings
Information: Tagline: Private Practice meeting with a RIM teacher
Information: Quote: "First, rely on the spirit and meaning of the teachings, not on the words; Second, rely on the teachings, not on the personality of the teacher; Third, rely on real wisdom, not superficial interpretation; And fourth, rely on the essence of your pure Wisdom Mind, not on judgmental perceptions."
Information: Program Description:
About Private Meetings

Private Teacher Meetings provide support and guidance to help you learn, deepen, and integrate the benefits of meditation and mindfulness into your whole life.

While dialogue and questions are strongly encouraged in group classes, there are times when it's not fitting to ask personal questions or explore sensitive topics within a large group setting. Sometimes, an inquiry may need more time and attention than a group setting can provide. Private meetings can be immensely supportive for anyone who is seriously committed to their practice and learning.

Who can participate?

Private meetings are open to all active RIM members who have already been introduced to mindfulness and meditation. We ask that you are sincere and committed to your learning and practice and prepared to engage in the inner work required for self-awareness and cultivation.

What to Expect:

Private meetings are held in a supportive and contemplative framework. Please know that these meetings are not therapy sessions. Nevertheless, they do provide you with an opportunity to share honestly, sincerely, and intimately about your inner and outer life experiences as they relate to your meditation and mindful living practice.

This sincere and open sharing allows the teacher to suggest relevant meditation practices, home contemplations, and traditional dharma and modern mindfulness-based teachings.

Preparing for Your Private Meeting

Please be mindful of your intentions for scheduling a private meeting with the teacher. These sessions are not casual meetings. Instead, they provide meaningful support for your personal and spiritual development.

Please download and fill out a Private Meeting Worksheet before your meeting to ensure a meaningful and supportive session.

Meeting Duration and Frequency

Each session is typically scheduled for a half-hour or an hour at a time. The frequency of sessions is determined on an individual basis. Sometimes one meeting is enough; other times, more frequent sessions are appropriate.
Registration: SIGNED-OUT Instructions: To participate in this and other RIM community programs, please Create a (free) Member Account. Once you have an account, simply Sign-In and schedule a private session.
Registration: SIGNED-IN Instructions:
Teacher schedules are currently full.

Schedule with Jesse Foy.

Name: Qigong at RIM
Information: Quote: Body practice is the root of spiritual practice. When we calm the body, the mind can expand without limit.
Information: Quote Source: Kenneth S. Cohen, The Way of Qigong: The Art and Science of Chinese Energy Healing
Information: Program Description:
What is Qigong?

Qigong (chee-gong) is a traditional Chinese health practice combining gentle movements, meditation, and controlled breathing to cultivate and harmonize the body's "qi," a type of life energy that flows throughout the universe.

An integral part of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM), qigong helps to restore and rebalance the body’s energy using the same meridians that are used in acupuncture. Because qigong practitioners believe that an incorrect posture can disrupt the flow of energy through these meridians, qigong invites us to become better aware of our bodies, giving ourselves friendly, supportive care on our road to better health. No matter where we are in our life’s journey, consistent practice of qigong can help to regain or sustain vitality, calm and center the mind, and maintain overall better health as we age.

KM Qigong at RIM

In this KM Qigong group, we will be introduced to one of the most famous and widely practiced qigong sets, the Eight Pieces of Brocade, or Baduanjin.

As the weeks progress, we will learn the movements and intentions of each of the exercises of the Eight Pieces, explore basic qigong concepts, and introduce ways to accommodate for range of motion challenges and other health limitations. Please join us in this journey of self-discovery as we learn new ways to take care of ourselves, both body and mind.

The Qigong group will meet on Zoom every Wednesday from 10:00 to 10:45 a.m. People who miss classes are free to join when they can, as concepts and movements will be continuously re-examined along the way.
Information: Special Notes:
The first class is on Wednesday, July 16.

For class, you will need:

  • Comfortable, loose clothing and shoes without substantial heels.
  • A supportive chair, one without arm rests and which allows the feet to rest flat on the floor, is suggested for the warm-up before the qigong.
  • As one of the Brocades steps widely to the right and then to the left, a roughly 6-foot by 4-foot square exercise space should be allowed for the safety of movements.
Details: Date Text: Every Wednesday | First Session on July 16

Name: RIM Greater Community Engagement
Information: Quote: "Once there is seeing, there must be acting."
Information: Program Description:
Service to our community awakens our hearts and minds through direct actions of compassion and generosity. By offering to serve we are practicing collective well-being.

Engagement is at the heart of our interconnectedness.

‍
Information: Special Notes:
Please help us widen our reach!

We are looking to support local agencies of care -- food banks, outreach services, Ronald McDonald House -- with our direct engagement.

If you have an idea for a volunteering opportunity and are interested in facilitating an event, we would love to hear from you and support you.

‍
Registration: SIGNED-OUT Instructions:
To participate in this and other RIM community programs, please Create a (free) Member Account. If you already have an account, sign in and register.

‍
Registration: SIGNED-IN Instructions:
Please fill out the form below to share your idea for the RIM sangha to help serve the greater community.

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

‍

Name: Recovery Dharma
Information: Tagline: Buddhist Practices to Heal the Suffering of Addiction
Information: Quote: "This is a path to freedom from any repetitive and habitual behavior that causes suffering."
Information: Program Description:
Recovery Dharma is a peer-led movement and community that is unified by our trust in the potential of each of us to recover and find freedom from the suffering of addiction.

We believe that recovery means empowerment, and we support each other as partners walking the path of recovery together.

Our program uses Buddhist practices and principles of meditation, self-inquiry, wisdom, compassion, and community as tools for recovery and healing.

Recovery Dharma welcomes anyone looking to heal from addiction and addictive behavior, whether caused by substance use or process addictions like codependency, gambling, eating disorders, relationships, technology, or any obsessive or habitual pattern that creates suffering.

Our meetings are open to anyone interested in recovery from addiction of all kinds. No meditation experience is necessary.
Details: Dana Text: Offered in the Spirit of Generosity (Dana)

Name: Sangha Community Service at Ronald McDonald House
Information: Quote: Bringing hope, comfort and care when it’s needed most.
Information: Quote Source: Laurie Bertrand, President & CEO, RMHC Eastern WI
Information: Program Description:
The Ronald McDonald House aims to provide essential services that remove barriers, strengthen families and promote healing when children need healthcare. The family meal program relieves the stress of meal planning and preparation, so that guests can focus on what matters most – their children.

Come and help us feed these families. Your time, service and hospitality make this possible!

‍
Information: Special Notes:
Before signing up to help with the cooking please read these volunteer guidelines.

https://rmhc-easternwi.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/New-2025-Dinner-Guidelines.pdf

We are also asking for food donations. We will let you know what is needed. You can then select a food item to donate.

* Perishable items must be dropped at RIM during the hours of 9-11 am on Saturday April 18th. (Meat must the thawed and ready to cook.)

‍
Details: Location Text: * Food Donations to RIM | Event at Ronald McDonald House, 8948 Watertown Plank Road, Milwaukee, WI 53226

Name: The Art of Meditation
Information: Tagline: Learning and Deepening a Skillful Meditation Practice
Information: Quote: "Meditation brings wisdom; lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back, and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
Information: Program Description:
About this Drop-In

Are you looking to bring more peace and balance into your life? Our ongoing drop-ins can help. Each week, RIM offers formal teachings, guided mindfulness meditations, and opportunities for discussion and questions. These drop-ins are designed to help you develop and deepen a formal meditation practice that can bring health and healing to your body, heart, mind, and overall well-being.

Whether you are looking to reduce stress, improve your physical and mental health, or simply find a greater sense of inner peace, our class can provide the tools and support you need. We invite you to join us and discover the benefits of a regular meditation practice.
Information: Special Notes: No prior experience is necessary to join us. Whether you are a beginner or a seasoned practitioner, everyone is welcome to participate. These drop-ins are held every Tuesday morning in-person or online (Zoom). There is no need to register in advance. Simply show up and join us in cultivating a sense of inner peace and clarity.
Registration: SIGNED-OUT Instructions: To participate in this and other RIM community programs, please Create a (free) Member Account. If you already have an account, simply Sign-In and go to your dashboard.
Registration: SIGNED-IN Instructions: As a RIM Community Member, you have access to this course. Attend in-person at RIM or access the zoom link in your dashboard.
Dashboard: Early Arrival Message: You are welcome to join within 10 minutes of the start time for community sharing and fellowship.

Name: The Heart of Wisdom
Information: Quote: "Breathing in, I calm body and mind. Breathing out, I smile. Dwelling in the present moment, I know this is the only moment."
Information: Program Description:
Cultivate an Open Heart and an Awakened Mind

Join us for a transformative four-day, three-night retreat that will help you cultivate true well-being and live with greater presence, wisdom, and compassion.

We all benefit by taking time to nourish our hearts, minds, and life. This retreat, held mostly in Noble Silence, allows you to step back from your daily routine and connect with the truth and beauty of your true nature, surrounded by like-minded people on a similar journey.

A Safe and Supportive Environment

This retreat is held at Holy Wisdom Monastery, just outside of Madison, WI, providing a safe and nurturing refuge where all your essential needs are taken care of, allowing you to rest deeply in the sacred space that all participants co-create with their shared intentions and practice.

The format is profoundly supportive and gentle, providing ample time and space for practice, contemplation, and self-care. You'll have the opportunity to practice with a community, alone, in the meditation hall, and outdoors in nature, immersing yourself in the tranquility of your surroundings.

A Structured Yet Comfortable Schedule

The retreat schedule is structured yet comfortable, balancing group practice and activities with personal meditation, contemplation, and self-care time.

Your experienced teachers will offer guided and unguided meditations and teachings to support your learning and practice. You'll have the freedom to reflect, connect with your inner and outer life experiences, and enjoy the beauty of nature.

Cultivate Mindfulness, Wisdom, and Compassion

During this retreat, you'll delve into meditation and mindfulness practices, developing a deeper connection with your breath, body, mind, and life. You'll touch and nourish your inner wisdom, sometimes obscured by the noise of daily life and habitual thoughts, emotions, and activities, and cultivate understanding and compassion for yourself and others.

As you turn your attention inward, you'll become more aware of what is important, what can be let go of, and what can be nourished and cultivated. You will see how to turn toward your life holistically and skillfully, empowering yourself to cultivate what is wholesome and to transform what prevents you from living with wisdom, compassion, connection, and well-being.

Integrate Your Experiences into Daily Life

The true power of this retreat lies not only in the experiences you'll have during your stay but also in how you'll be able to carry these experiences with you when you return home. You'll discover that you will be empowered to better integrate Mindfulness, wisdom, and compassion into your daily activities, transforming your relationship with yourself, others, and the world around you. As you continue to cultivate these qualities, you'll find that your life becomes more peaceful, joyful, and fulfilling.

Your Life is Precious; Take Time to Be Present with It

Rooted In Mindfulness invites you to take special time to connect to yourself, care for yourself, and live a life full of presence, self-discovery, healing, wakefulness, and freedom. Join us for this 4-day, 3-night retreat. Experience the gift of sacred time and space where you can nourish your Heart of Wisdom.

Reserve your spot today and take a mindful and compassionate step toward the peace and well-being you seek.

Retreat Fees:

The overnight guest rooms at the monastery are fully booked, so we’ve reserved a block of rooms at a nearby hotel for those wishing to attend this transformative four-day, three-night retreat.

Retreat Registration Only: $425

Includes vegetarian lunches and dinners.

To secure the RIM discount, hotel accommodations are to be made by each retreat attendee before August 11.
Information: Special Notes: The overnight guest rooms at the monastery are fully booked; however, due to considerable interest in this annual retreat, we’ve reserved a block of rooms at a nearby hotel for those wishing to attend this transformative four-day, three-night retreat. We will send you a link to reserve your room at The Fairfield Inn in Middleton with your registration receipt. If you prefer to learn more about the hotel accommodations before you register, please follow this link.
